usefulItems: cling film, rolling pin, large baking trays, baking paper, wire rack, airtight container, refrigerator, oven
title: Chocolate Orange Pinwheel Biscuits

ingredients.content: ½ orange, thin peelings of skin only

preparations.content: Place sugar and orange peel in mixing bowl then grind <b>8 sec/speed 9<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add butter and mix <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then mix again <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>.
Add flour and egg then mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>. Set scales to zero and remove 350 g dough (scales will show -350 g), flatten into a rectangle then wrap in cling film.

Add cocoa powder to remaining dough in mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 4<b>. Tip out, flatten into a rectangle then wrap in another piece of cling film. Place both pieces of dough in fridge to rest for 1 hour.

After this time, roll out each piece of rested dough, between two pieces of cling film, to a rectangle (approx. 28 cm x 22 cm x 5 mm). Remove cling film then place chocolate layer on top of plain one. Lightly roll over surface with a rolling pin to join layers together.
Roll up from long edge of dough tightly into a log, removing any air pockets as you go. Wrap log in cling film and place in fridge for 2 hours or overnight.
After this time, preheat oven to 170°C and line 2 large baking trays with baking paper.
Remove cling film then slice log into 5 mm thick biscuits. Arrange on prepared trays and bake for 10-12 minutes (170°C) until lightly golden.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before serving or storing in an airtight container until needed.

hintsAndTricks: These pretty pinwheel biscuits are flavoured with the winning combination of chocolate and orange. They look impressive and are fun to create, making it a great one to do with the kids. Enjoy with a warm mug of cocoa for elevenses or afternoon tea.
The recipe can be made in advance up to <b>step 6<b> then frozen before baking. Defrost in the fridge overnight or leave to thaw at room temperature for <b>30 minutes<b> before slicing and baking.
